DOC.brief_summary: Changes of Upper and Lower Limb Blood Flow and Vascular Resistance in Hyperbaric Spinal Anesthesia for TURP Using Duplex Ultrasonography: Comparison of Normotensive and Hypertensive Patients.
DOC.brief_title: Changes of Upper and Lower Limb Blood Flow and Vascular Resistance in Hyperbaric Spinal Anesthesia for Transurethral Resection of the Prostate (TURP) Using Duplex Ultrasonography: Comparison of Normotensive and Hypertensive Patients
DOC.criteria: males (> 65 yr) were scheduled to have spinal anaesthesia for TURP patients with peripheral vascular disease chronic venous insufficiency prior deep vein thrombosis (DVT) defined by the presence of thrombosis on duplex or the presence of ultrasonographic signs indicating a previous DVT body mass index >35 prior lower limb surgery due to arterial or venous trauma history of diabetes or autonomic deficiency.
DOC.keyword: Male patients scheduled to have spinal anaesthesia for TURP
